content: re playing with the moss stitch also called linen stitch don t worry it s still super simple it s just single_crochet chain 1 skip 1 repeated across the row the little chain spaces give you a pretty soft texture starting chain 17 row 1 single_crochet across row 2+ moss stitch single_crochet chain 1 skip 1 across working your single_crochet into the chain spaces on each new row keep going until your block is a square then fasten_off and weave in your tails pattern block 4 moss stitch square starting chain 17 terms us crochet terms abbreviations chain chain single_crochet single_crochet st s stitch es chain-space chain space notes turning chains do not count as a stitch row 1 is all single_crochet the moss stitch pattern begins on row 2 pg 9 www hodgepodge-crochet com from row 2 on you ll be doing single_crochet chain 1 skip 1 single_crochet chain 1 skip 1… work your single_crochet stitches into the chain-1 spaces on the next row use your larger crochet hook for this pattern block instructions 1 foundation chain chain 17 2 row 1 single_crochet base row single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across turn 16 single_crochet 3 row 2 start moss stitch chain 1 does not count as a stitch single_crochet in first st *chain 1 skip next st single_crochet in next st repeat from * across the row until 1 stitch remains then single_crochet in the last st turn 4 row 3 chain 1 does not count as a stitch single_crochet in first st *chain 1 single_crochet in next chain-1 space work into the hole under the chain repeat from * across until you reach the last st then single_crochet in the last st turn 5 row 4 and all following row repeat row 3 until your block is roughly square 6 finish fasten_off and weave in all tails so your block is neat and ready to join later day 5 lemon peel stitch square today we re making block 5 lemon peel stitch square this stitch is just single_crochet and double_crochet but the trick is how you place them you always put a single_crochet into a double_crochet from the row below and a double_crochet into a single_crochet if you ever see two single crochets stacked on top of each other or two doubles that means something went off in that row pg 10 www hodgepodge-crochet com starting chain 17 row 1 single_crochet double_crochet repeat across row 2+ chain 2 then always single_crochet into a double_crochet double_crochet into a single_crochet across work in pattern until your block is a square then fasten_off and weave in your tails pattern block 5 lemon peel stitch square starting chain 17 terms us crochet terms abbreviations chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet st s stitch es notes important turning chains do not count as a stitch you will always have 16 stitches in each
